knimeNode.name: Database Row Filter
knimeNode.shortDescription: The Database Row Filter allows to filter rows from database table.

fullDescription.intro: This node allows rows to be filtered from the input database table while the SQL result will only contain the remaining rows. Within the dialog, an SQL WHERE clause is interactively created by selecting a column, an operator, and a filter value.
fullDescription.option: Contains the columns available in the input table.
With the WHERE clause, the following operators can be used: =, <>, !=, >, <, >=, <=, BETWEEN, LIKE, IN
Enter the specific value to filter on. Quotes ('') need to be added when filtering string columns. A "%" sign can be used to define wildcard pattern.

ports.inPort: Table in database to apply row filter
ports.outPort: Table in the database with filtered rows
